I couldn't get myself to work anymore

How I solved a problem money couldn't fix.

Michael Wong (Mizko) ⚡️
Jul 28
READ IN APP

Hey beautiful human 👋,

I got something vulnerable to share with you today.

Over the last 2 years I've struggled to stay motivated (with work).

My wife would find me doing random mobility exercises in the living room when I should've been crushing projects.

It's odd for me because I've always been obsessed with my work.

I loved it.

Day in, day out, I was cooking.

Building businesses, teaching design, solving problems... it was my thing.

But something shifted, and I couldn't figure out what.

I knew something was up, but I didn't know why.

So I did something that felt completely counterintuitive...

I intentionally let my drive for work deteriorate even more.

I wanted to go with the flow instead of fighting against it.

If I didn't feel like working, I wouldn't.

Instead, I trained for my first half marathon, dove deeper into Muay Thai, worked on reclaiming my mobility after sitting most of my life and spent time more intentionally with the simple things around me.
My first half marathon - HOKKA

During this time, I felt great about life but I felt super lost when it came to work.

At times I felt guilty and confused about what I was doing.

I worried I was wasting my potential and being lazy.

But eventually, something clicked.

My mind was at peace.

My nervous system had reset.

I became okay with not working. I could think clearer than I had in years.

And that's when I realized what had happened...

My 'why' had completely shifted, but I hadn't noticed.

Growing up in a migrant family, I was taught one thing…

Work hard, make money, and life will be better. My grandparents said it. My parents said it. My closest and most trusted people said it.

So I did exactly that.

I worked my ass off. Made some millies.

But here's the thing that nobody talks about...

When your entire life was geared towards making money to survive, but then you no longer really need more to survive...

What do you do?

This sounds like such a privileged problem (and it is), but it was still my problem.

I knew I still enjoyed doing what I do, solving problems, and being valuable to people.

But I just couldn't figure out how to re-ignite the drive, when my why had changed.

Over the last 3 months, I felt a spark whilst working.

But the 'why' behind what I do now is purely determined by what I want to do, not what makes the most money.

The more I focused on doing what I love, the more the spark ignited.

I've said no to hundreds of thousands of dollars worth of sponsorship deals.

I've said no to hundreds of thousands of dollars worth of client project opportunities.

I even turned off my contact form so prospects can't book me in anymore.

Moving forward, I've decided I will only work on things that I genuinely want to work on, and I'm no longer at the mercy of the rat race.

Don't get me wrong... I still want to make money and I still need to make money.

Building anything of value requires time and money.

But money is no longer the primary driver.

I'm still running Designership with over 15k ambitious people learning from me, with hundreds of new people signing up each month.

I just launched my Figma Masterclass 2.0 course a few weeks ago.

Feedback has been soooooooooo positive 🥹

My goal is to keep creating courses on topics that I'm passionate about.

I'm also deep in building a new app for creators and businesses that leverage content to drive their businesses. I'm actually using it right now to write this newsletter.

I'm investing my own hard-earned money into this, with no investors, because I want to do things how I want to do them.

Here's what I've learnt...

Your motivations are shaped by your upbringing, but they WILL change over time.

As you mature and grow, your environment shifts, your situation changes, and what you used to want will be radically different.

If you're finding yourself in a similar situation where you feel a lack of motivation, here's my simple framework:

  1. Reset: Give your nervous system time to reset. You can't make rationale decisions when your nervous system is firing off left, right and center. I know I'm lucky to run my own businesses, which means I can take time off, but find a way to take a true break. Have real intention behind wanting that break. Let your nervous system reset so you can think in a calm state with true clarity.

  2. Assess: Think about what used to motivate you. What were your objectives? Then compare them to what drives you today. The gap between these two is where your answer lives.

  3. Restart: Ease back into the work you do. Slowly and steadily. Avoid anything that triggers a negative response. Approach things differently this time as you apply your new learnings about yourself to your craft.

Everyone has different motivations and interests, so you'll need to apply this framework to your own situation.

But here's the thing I want you to remember...

Work becomes infinitely more fulfilling when it's optional.

When you're not just focused on making more money (because your investments cover your needs), you're purely doing what you enjoy.

And that, my friend, is when the real magic happens.

Whatever your version of "enough" is, there will likely be a period where you suffer to get there. Because anything worth having usually doesn't come easy.

But once you're past that point?

You get to work entirely on your own terms.

And trust me, it's worth the journey.

But it will require a mindset shift.

How can I help you?

Here are a few ways I can help you crush your career goals (just like me):

🖥️ Master Figma 2.0 (20 hours) - I just launched my Figma Masterclass 2.0 course! Become an expert in Figma so you can get more done; faster and better. This isn't just a technical course about features, it's an end-to-end course on how Figma fits into a real-world project. (8,500+ designers)

💼 Build confidence in end-to-end UX/UI design (10 hours) - You've mastered the tool and UX research and now you want to learn how to lead, design and manage a project end-to-end. Dive deep into every little step alongside me with a real-world project. (400+ designers)

🔍 Dive-deep into UX Research & Strategy (10 hours) - Learn how to run UX and business research to make more strategic and data-informed decisions for larger scaled projects and improved stakeholder management. (800+ designers)

⚡️Design 10X faster with 8,000+ pre-designed components - We just launched v.2.7.1. If you're starting every project from scratch, you're probably wasting a lot of time. Leverage Shipfaster UI to speed up your process dramatically. (3,400+ designers)

That's it for this month!

Oh and incase you missed it, I dropped my latest Figma Masterclass 2.0 course a few weeks ago. Now with over 8,500 designers world-wide on it.

Your boy,

- Mizko
